intro: Kreodanthus loxoglottis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed kreodanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a short, upright stem. Kreodanthus loxoglottis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
